raw.title: [ARFC] Add LUSD Arbitrum v3
raw.author: 0x16645967f660AC05EA542D3DE2f46E41b86436d9
raw.body:
---

title: [ARFC] Add LUSD Arbitrum v3
author: @Llama - @TokenLogic
created: 2023-04-23

---

# Summary

This publication presents the community with the opportunity to add LUSD to Aave Arbitrum v3. 

# Abstract

LUSD is decentralised stable coin backed by ETH that is minted on the non-custodial, immutable, and governance-free, Liquidity Protocol.

Adding LUSD to Arbitrum will promote stable coin diversity. All Liquidity Protocol contracts are immutable, which makes LUSD the most trustless stablecoin available.

This publication proposes listing LUSD with collateral disabled (LTV 0%) with borrowing enabled. 

# Motivation

LUSD is currently listed on the following Aave deployments:

* Ethereum v3
* Ethereum v2
* Optimism v3

This publication seeks to list LUSD on Aave v3 Arbitrum.

Past publications, [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/arc-add-lusd-to-ethereum-v3-market/11522) and [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/arc-add-support-for-lusd-liquity/8443) provide insight and context.

LUSD brings more stable coin diversity to the Aave Protocol and will further empower the support for decentralized stablecoins. The LUSD stable coin mechanism is relatively simple and is in line with the risk averse ethos of the Aave Community.

LUSD is overcollateralised by ETH with two main mechanisms helping it keep its peg: 

* LUSD can be redeemed for ETH at face value (i.e., 1 LUSD for $1 of ETH). 
* Minimal collateral ratio of 110%.
 
Both mechanisms respectively create a price floor and ceiling through arbitrage opportunities.

LUSD on Arbitrum and Optimism relies on users transferring LUSD through each networks respective bridge to arbitrage the price variation across the networks.

This proposal aims to add LUSD as a borrowable asset (LTV 0%).

Chainlink Oracle LUSD/USD [`0x0411D28c94d85A36bC72Cb0f875dfA8371D8fFfF`](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x0411D28c94d85A36bC72Cb0f875dfA8371D8fFfF)

# Specification

Ticker: LUSD

Contract Address: [`0x93b346b6BC2548dA6A1E7d98E9a421B42541425b`](https://arbiscan.io/token/0x93b346b6bc2548da6a1e7d98e9a421b42541425b)

|Parameter|Value|
| --- | --- |
|Isolation Mode|No |
|Borrowable|Yes |
|Collateral Enabled| No |
|Supply Cap | 900,000 units |
|Borrow Cap | 900,000 units|
|Debt Ceiling| 0 |
|LTV| NA |
|LT| NA |
|Liquidation Bonus| NA |
|Liquidation Protocol Fee |NA|
|Variable Base|0.00%|
|Variable Slope1|4.00%|
|Variable Slope2|87.00%|
|Uoptimal|80.00|
|Reserve Factor|10.00%|
|Stable Borrowing|Disabled|
|Stable Slope1|4.00%|
|Stable Slope2|87.00%|
|Base Stable Rate Offset|1.00%|
|Stable Rate Excess Offset|8.00%|
|Optimal Stable To Total Debt Ratio|20.00%|

# Disclaimer

@llamaxyz and contributor, @TokenLogic, are not associated with or compensated by Liquity for publishing this AFRC.

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [ARFC] Add 1INCH to Aave V3 Ethereum
raw.author: 0xc3c0f1E5D497dc6E6FAc9F8fBB548806a7e72CC0
raw.body:
# Summary

This proposal presents Aave with the opportunity to onboard 1INCH to the Etheruem Aave V3 Market.

# Motivation

As part of the community efforts on the V2 to V3 migration, Chaos Labs proposed a [multi-phased plan](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-ethereum-v2-to-v3-migration/12636) to promote V3 adoption. As per this plan, Chaos Labs proposes to list 1INCH on Aave V3 on Ethereum. 1INCH is currently listed on V2 Ethereum with borrow disabled.

As the proposed assets in the migration plan are traded with relatively low market cap and trading volume, we have taken a prudent approach in setting borrow caps to account for no more than 1% of the average daily trading volume. The supply cap was derived using our supply cap methodology with the V2 data (simulation results can be seen in the image below). Additionally, we have  adjusted the IR Slope1 to reflect the changes in interest rates over the past months and adjusted the liquidation bonus levels to the current liquidity levels in DEXs.


# Specification

Ticker: 1INCH

Contract Address: 0x111111111117dC0aa78b770fA6A738034120C302

| Parameter | 1INCH |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | Yes |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap | 22M |
| Borrow Cap | 720,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | $4.5M |
| LTV | 57.00% |
| LT | 67.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 7.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% |
| Variable Base | 0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 9.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 300.00% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 20.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Stable Slope1 | 13.00% |
| Stable Slope2 | 300.00% |
| Base Stable Rate Offset | 3.00% |
| Stable Rate Excess Offset | 5.00% |
| Optimal Stable To Total Debt Ratio | 20.00% |
| Flahloanable | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No |
| Borrowed in Isolation | No |

# Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached and the proposal is refined, submit the ARFC for a snapshot vote for final approval.
2. If consensus is reached, submit an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) to onboard 1INCH on the Ethereum Aave V3 pool.

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.body:
# Summary

This proposal presents Aave with the opportunity to onboard ENS to the Etheruem Aave V3 Market.

# Motivation

As part of the community efforts on the V2 to V3 migration, Chaos Labs proposed a [multi-phased plan](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-ethereum-v2-to-v3-migration/12636) to promote V3 adoption. As per this plan, Chaos Labs proposes to list ENS on Aave V3 on Ethereum. ENS is currently listed on V2 Ethereum with borrow disabled.

As the proposed assets in the migration plan are traded with relatively low market cap and trading volume, we have taken a prudent approach in setting borrow caps to account for no more than 1% of the average daily trading volume. The supply cap was derived using our supply cap methodology with the V2 data (simulation results can be seen in the image below). Additionally, we have  adjusted the IR Slope1 to reflect the changes in interest rates over the past months and adjusted the liquidation bonus levels to the current liquidity levels in DEXs.

# Specification

Ticker: ENS

Contract Address: 0xC18360217D8F7Ab5e7c516566761Ea12Ce7F9D72

| Parameter | ENS |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | Yes |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap | 1M |
| Borrow Cap | 40,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | $3.9M |
| LTV | 39.00% |
| LT | 49.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 8.00% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% |
| Variable Base | 0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 9.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 300.00% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 20.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Stable Slope1 | 13.00% |
| Stable Slope2 | 300.00% |
| Base Stable Rate Offset | 3.00% |
| Stable Rate Excess Offset | 5.00% |
| Optimal Stable To Total Debt Ratio | 20.00% |
| Flahloanable | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No |
| Borrowed in Isolation | No |

# Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached and the proposal is refined, submit the ARFC for a snapshot vote for final approval.
2. If consensus is reached, submit an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) to onboard ENS on the Ethereum Aave V3 pool.

# Copyright

cleaned.title: [ARFC] Add MAI to Optimism Aave V3 pool
cleaned.author: 0x329c54289Ff5D6B7b7daE13592C6B1EDA1543eD4

raw.title: [ARFC] Add MAI to Optimism Aave V3 pool
raw.author: 0x329c54289Ff5D6B7b7daE13592C6B1EDA1543eD4
raw.body:
---
Title: [ARFC] Add MAI to Optimism Aave V3 pool
Author: @marczeller - Aave-Chan Initiative
Date: 2023-04-13
---

# Summary

This proposal presents Aave with the opportunity to onboard MAI to the Optimism Aave V3 Market.

# Abstract

MAI is a decentralized stablecoin minted by the Qidao Protocol. For more details about MAI, please refer to [Qidao's official website](https://www.mai.finance/).

# Motivation

Supporting stablecoin diversity is part of the Aave-Chan Initiative (ACI) delegate platform. The risk parameters provided are the same as those adopted on the Polygon PoS Aave V3 Pool.

The newly proposed risk parameters replicating the MAI parameters on Polygon V3 pool are merely suggestions to start the conversation. The ACI is inviting Risk Service Providers to provide feedback on them.

# Specification

Ticker: MAI
Contract Address: 0xdFA46478F9e5EA86d57387849598dbFB2e964b02

| Risk Parameter        | Value    |
| --------------------- | -------- |
| Isolation Mode        | YES      |
| Enable Borrow         | YES      |
| Enable Collateral     | NO       |
| Loan To Value         | 75%      |
| Liquidation Threshold | 80%      |
| Liquidation Bonus     | 5%       |
| Reserve Factor        | 20%      |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10%    |
| Borrow Cap            | 1,200k   |
| Supply Cap            | 2,200k   |
| Debt Ceiling          | 2,000k   |
| Base                  | 0%       |
| Slope1                | 4%       |
| Uoptimal              | 80%      |
| Slope2                | 75%      |

# Disclaimer

The ACI is not affiliated with Qidao or any other entity and has not received payment to present this ARFC.

At the time of writing, the author (@marczeller) owns QI & vQI, the native asset of the Qidao Protocol, for ~50k$. The author was not paid to publish this ARFC.

# Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached, submit an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) to onboard MAI on the Optimism Aave V3 pool.

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.body:
---
Title: [ARFC] Add MAI to Arbitrum Aave V3 pool
Author: @marczeller - Aave-Chan Initiative
Date: 2023-04-13
---

# Summary

This proposal presents Aave with the opportunity to onboard MAI to the Arbitrum Aave V3 Market.

# Abstract

MAI is a decentralized stablecoin minted by the Qidao Protocol. For more details about MAI, please refer to [Qidao's official website](https://www.mai.finance/).

# Motivation

Supporting stablecoin diversity is part of the Aave-Chan Initiative (ACI) delegate platform. The risk parameters provided are the same as those adopted on the Polygon PoS Aave V3 Pool.

The newly proposed risk parameters replicating the MAI parameters on Polygon V3 pool are merely suggestions to start the conversation. The ACI is inviting Risk Service Providers to provide feedback on them.

# Specification

Ticker: MAI
Contract Address: 0x3f56e0c36d275367b8c502090edf38289b3dea0d

|Risk Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
|Isolation Mode|YES|
|Enable Borrow|YES|
|Enable Collateral|YES (in isolation mode)|
|Loan To Value|75%|
|Liquidation Threshold|80%|
|Liquidation Bonus|7.5%|
|Reserve Factor| 20%|
|Liquidation Protocol Fee|10%|
|Borrow Cap|1,000k|
|Supply Cap|1,200k|
|Debt Ceiling|2,000k|
|Base|0%|
|Slope1|4%|
|Uoptimal|80%|
|Slope2|75%|

# Disclaimer

The ACI is not affiliated with Qidao or any other entity and has not received payment to present this ARFC.

At the time of writing, the author (@marczeller) owns QI & vQI, the native asset of the Qidao Protocol, for ~50k$. The author was not paid to publish this ARFC.

# Next Steps

If consensus is reached, submit an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) to onboard MAI on the Arbitrum Aave V3 pool.

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

decision.summary: Proposal to add fUSDC as collateral to Aave V3 Ethereum with conservative risk parameters including isolation mode, no borrowable option, and a supply cap of approximately $4.45M. The proposal is backed by risk assessments recommending isolation mode to limit risk exposure due to fUSDC's underlying Flux protocol dependencies and nascent market data.
key_arguments_for: Adding fUSDC enables holders to leverage positions and borrow stablecoins on Aave, potentially boosting stablecoin utilization and attracting deposits.
Risk analysis supports isolation mode to contain risk exposure, with collateral enabled but borrowing disabled, aligning with conservative governance preferences.
The supply cap and debt ceiling parameters are prudently set to balance risk and utility, with the possibility to adjust after monitoring asset usage and liquidity.
Historical similar proposals to add assets in isolation mode showed positive community support and no significant negative outcomes.
key_arguments_against: fUSDC depends on Flux Finance and OUSG collateral, which are permissioned and carry smart contract and centralization risks.
Liquidity on Flux is limited and volatile, requiring close monitoring and potentially rapid governance reactions.
Concentration risk exists as the top three suppliers hold 70% of the total supply, increasing vulnerability to market moves.
Some community members express concerns that isolation mode prevents borrowing WETH, limiting potential use cases.

evidence.quote: The majority of forum comments express cautious support with emphasis on isolation mode and conservative debt ceilings due to Flux protocol risks.
Timeline metrics show stable and early strong support for 'YAE' option with 100% lead ratio across all quartiles and high stability.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline analytics strongly support 'YAE' with stable early and sustained voting momentum.
- Forum sentiment is mostly cautious yet supportive of the proposal, emphasizing risk containment via isolation mode and conservative caps.
- Historical similar proposals adding assets in isolation mode were successful and did not negatively impact protocol stability.
- Market and TVL impacts are negative but should be interpreted with caution; the recommendation prioritizes long-term protocol health.
- The recommendation aligns with aggregated forum sentiment and governance analytics, promoting a prudent but forward-looking asset addition.
